amendment.description: Amendment increases funding for NASA program management by $81.5 million. \ As amended by the Sensenbrenner amendment (A012) the above increase in funding was accomplished by reducing other accounts by $73 million and transferring $8.5 from the travel account into personnel.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 24 in the Congressional Record of May 22, 1996, to reduce the amount authorized in the bill for Space Science by $60 million and increases the authorization for Research and Program Management by an equal amount.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Weldon (FL) amendment (A011) as amended Agreed to by recorded vote: 354 - 60 (Roll no. 203).
